text: Facebook is going to take out $218 per share, CNBC's Jim Cramer says. The stock hit that all-time high last summer.

title: Facebook shows it’s ‘really sticky’ as investors shrug off expected FTC fine
text: Despite spats with the government and controversies about data mishandling, Facebook Inc. is doing what it does best.

title: Facebook broke Canadian privacy law, joint probe finds
text: The latest damning assessment of Facebook’s trampling of user privacy comes from the Canadian and Columbia privacy commissioners — which have just published the results of an investigation kicked off in the wake of the Cambridge Analytica data misuse scandal last year.

title: Cramer Recap: Facebook
text: The earnings storm continues. Jim Cramer dives in on Facebook

title: Investors are excited about innovation at Facebook, says analyst
text: Mark May, Citi senior internet analyst, joins "Squawk on the Street" to discuss Facebook's earnings and why the company's innovation may be good for investors.

title: Zuckerberg warns of authoritarian data localization trend
text: If free nations demand companies store data locally, it legitimizes that practice for authoritarian nations which can then steal that data for their own nefarious purposes, according to Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg.

title: Facebook says it’s open to advertising u-turn for the EU elections, enabling cross-border campaigns
text: Facebook’s VP of global affairs and communications, Nick Clegg, today said the social network — likely in response to pressure from European officials — is “open” to changing its rules on election advertising for European Union elections that will take place on May 23, by allowing cross-border campaigning rather than requiring those running ads in a specific market to be registered as businesses in those markets.

title: Facebook says it filed a US lawsuit to shut down a follower-buying service in New Zealand
text: Facebook is cracking down on services that promise to help Instagram users buy themselves a large following on the photo app.

title: Facebook is suing a New Zealand company and three people over fake Instagram likes
text: Facebook filed a lawsuit in a U.S. federal court against a New Zealand company and three people for allegedly selling fake likes, views and followers to Instagram users.

title: Facebook Earnings: What You Should Know
text: The stories format could morph into a major catalyst for the social network.

text: Three million active advertisers -- and it's just getting started.

title: CNBC's interview with investor Chamath Palihapitiya on Facebook

title: Instagram will now let creators and influencers sell items directly
text: The monetization hose is on full blast at Instagram now, and today at F-8 Facebook unveiled one of the latest developments on that front. The company said that creators will now be able to tag items to sell them directly to people viewing their posts and Stories.

title: Facebook is rolling out the biggest change to its app in the past five years
text: Facebook is rolling out the biggest change to its app in the past five years, CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced at the company’s F8 Developer Conference on Tuesday.

title: Facebook's $724 Billion Ad Market
text: More ad dollars are going to digital every year.

title: Facebook Dating opens to friends with Secret Crush
text: Facebook built Dating to be privacy-safe, hoping to avoid the awkwardness of friends or family checking out your romance profile.

title: Workplace, Facebook’s enterprise edition, gets a reboot to boost activity and cut down on noise
text: At F-8 today, Facebook is unveiling a major redesign for its desktop app — the first big update it’s made since 2014 — and a refresh of its mobile apps as it begins to bring its many functions, features and apps under a more unified umbrella.

title: Review: Oculus Quest could be the Nintendo Switch of VR
text: Facebook has bet a lot on its VR dream. The industry has become the butt of a few jokes in the past couple years as hype has deflated, but there’s been no question that the tech is interesting, the question has been whether it’s sustainably cool.

title: Review: Facebook’s Oculus Rift S is barely an upgrade
text: More than three years after Facebook released one of the biggest gambles in its existence, a virtual reality headset it paid billions to launch as its own, the company has grown more embattled but its moonshot VR flagship has grown safer.

title: Oculus Quest review: VR freedom comes at a cost
text: If the Oculus Go was an appetizer for truly wireless VR, which is entirely self-contained and doesn't rely on a PC, the Quest is closer to a main course.

title: Oculus Quest review: Best mobile VR
text: The Oculus Quest, Facebook's portable $399 VR headset, is a movable magic portal.

title: Oculus Quest review: can this save VR?
text: The Oculus Quest is a new take on virtual reality, offering high-end VR in a mobile package — but only with some compromises.

title: Facebook's latest gadget, at $399, convinced me its $2 billion bet on virtual reality will pay off
text: CNBC reviews the new Oculus Quest, which offers a full virtual reality experience without the need for a computer.

title: Facebook will allow patients in support groups to post questions anonymously
text: Facebook has provided a way for patients to post their questions anonymously, via administrators who will share it on their behalf.

text: The company says Facebook Dating will expand to 14 new countries, including Brazil and Malaysia.

title: Facebook updates PyTorch with a focus on production use
text: During last year’s F8 developer conference, Facebook announced the 1.0 launch of PyTorch, the company’s open source deep learning platform.

title: Facebook open-sources Ax and BoTorch to simplify AI model optimization
text: At its F8 developer conference, Facebook today launched Ax and BoTorch, two new open-source AI tools. BoTorch, which, as the name implies, is based on PyTorch, is a library for Bayesian optimization.

title: Why Facebook Share Prices Keep Going Up, Even Though Nobody Trusts the Company
text: When Facebook Inc. announced its first-quarter financial results last week, the company said it had set aside $3 billion to pay for an expected fine of between $3 billion and $5 billion from the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC).

title: Why Facebook Stock Is Compelling on Coronavirus Weakness

title: Facebook 2Q Sales Top Estimates, Shares Surge
text: Facebook Inc.’s second-quarter sales topped analysts’ highest estimates, rebounding from a pandemic-fueled disruption to digital advertising earlier in the year.
